question.title: How to rebuid the mspec file and generates an updated driver code file?
question.body:
I'm an individual C developer, and I have little knowledge of Java. I recently wrote a little program, and want to use the PLC4X in my project. According to the official documents, PLC4X allows developers to write a mspec file, then auto generate the tedious driver codes. The documentation only tells developers how to write a mspec file, but it does not tell how to build the mspec file.

For example, if I change the const variable plc4xTcpDefaultPort value from 59837 to 59999 in the protocols/plc4x/src/main/resources/protocols/plc4x/v0/plc4x.mspec file, how can I rebuild the mspec file and generates a new plc4c/generated-sources/plc4x/src/plc4x_constants.c file that the PLC4C_PLC4X_READ_WRITE_PLC4X_CONSTANTS_PLC4X_TCP_DEFAULT_PORT_const variable has a value of 59999?

I have look inside the project issues on github, there has no topic about the code generation. I Googled the "PLC4X code-generation" keyword, and there has little effective informations. I also asked OpenAI and Claude AI, all of the AIs give wrong answers. Can someone help me?
